title: How to Check Telus Voicemail from Another Phone

steps.title: If you're checking your voicemail from a smartphone, follow these steps.
steps.content: If you're checking your voicemail from a smartphone, follow these steps. Dial 1 + your ten-digit phone number. Press Send. You may be prompted to enter your password. From there, follow the voice commands.

steps.title: If you are checking your voicemail from a landline, the steps are a little different:
steps.content: If you are checking your voicemail from a landline, the steps are a little different: Dial your ten-digit phone number. If you are calling from a long distance, enter 1 before your phone number. Press * to interrupt the greeting. Enter your password. From there, follow the voice commands.

steps.title: Once you’ve accessed your mailbox, you can start listening to your voicemail.
steps.content: Once you’ve accessed your mailbox, you can start listening to your voicemail. [1] X Research source In the menu, use your keypad to navigate your options: Press 1 to listen to your messages. Press 2 to send a message. Press 3 to access your voicemail’s pre-recorded Greetings. You can record a personal greeting, initial an extended absence greeting, and manage your current greetings. Press 4 to access Personal Options. These include Group Lists, Pager Notifications, the ability to change your password, your voicemail’s language, and your recorded name. Press 1 or 9 to recover deleted and expired messages. Exit your voicemail by pressing **.

steps.title: Once you’ve selected a message to listen to, you can do a couple of things while listening.
steps.content: Once you’ve selected a message to listen to, you can do a couple of things while listening. [2] X Research source Use this key to navigate your message. Press 1 to rewind a message for 10 seconds. Press 2 to pause or resume the message. Press 3 to fast forward 10 seconds. Press 5 to hear the message time and date. Press 7 to delete the message. Press 9 to save the message. Press the # symbol to keep the message as new. Press the * symbol to return to the main menu.

steps.title: If you’ve finished listening to a message, you have a couple of choices.
steps.content: If you’ve finished listening to a message, you have a couple of choices. [3] X Research source Press 1 to replay the message. Press 5 to hear the message’s time and date. Press 6 to forward a copy of the message. Press 7 to delete the message. Press 9 to save the message. Press the # symbol to keep the message as new. Press the * symbol to return to the main menu.
